gurmukhi: bIs ibsvy Cl dwnv ko bn mY ijh Awn qumY fhkwXo ]
transliteration: Bees Bisve Chhal Daanav Ko Ban Mai Jih Aan Toumai Dahkaayo||
translation: “This is certainly the deceit of some demon, who has caused this deception in you.”

gurmukhi: ipAwrI ko Awies myt skY n iblok sIAw khu Awqur BwrI ]
transliteration: Piaariko Aais Met Sakai Na Bilok Seeaa Kauh Aatur Bhdaree||
translation: Seeing the affliction of Sita, Ram could not put aside her wish;

gurmukhi: bwND inKMg cly kit sO kih BRwq eIhwN kirjY rKvwrI ]353]
transliteration: Baandh Nikhanndchale Kattee Sau Kah(i) Bhraat Eehaan Karijai Rakhvdaree||353||
translation: He tied his quiver and left for bringing the golden deer, leaving behind Lakshman for Sita’s protection.353.

gurmukhi: Et QkXo kir koit inswcr sRI rGubIr indwn sMGwrXo ]
transliteration: Ot Thakyo Kar(i) Kottee Nisaachar Sriraghoubeer Nidaan Sanhdaryo||
translation: The demon Marich tried to put Ram in uncertainty by running away at a high speed, but ultimately he was tired and Ram killed him.

gurmukhi: hy lhu bIr aubwr lY mokh XO kihkY puin rwm pukwrXo ]
transliteration: He Lauh Beer Oubaar Lai Mokah Yau Kaih-kai Poun(i) Raam Poukdaryo||
translation: But at the time of death he shouted loudly in the voice of Ram, “O Brother, save me.”

gurmukhi: jwnkI bol kubol sunXo qb hI iqh Er suim`qR pTwXo ]
transliteration: Jaanakibol Koubol Sounyo Tab Hitih Or Soumittra Pathaayo||
translation: When Sita heard this frightening cry, she sent the mighty Lakshman to that side,

gurmukhi: ryK kmwn kI kwF mhwbl jwq Bey ieq rwvn AwXo ]354]
transliteration: Rekh Kamaan Kikaadh Mahaabal Jaat Bhae It Raavan Aayo||354||
translation: Who before leaving drew a line there and then Ravana came in.354.

gurmukhi: ByK AlyK aucwrkY rwvx jwq Bey sIA ky iFg XO ]
transliteration: Bhekh Alekh Ouchaar-kai Raavan Jaat Bhae Seea Ke Dhig Yau||
translation: Wearing the garb of a Yogi and uttering the traditional invocation for alms, Ravan went near Sita,

gurmukhi: Aivlok DnI Dnvwn bfo iqh jwie imlY mg mo Tg jXo ]
transliteration: Avilok Dhanidhanvaan Bado Tih Jaae Milai Mag Mo Thag Jyo||
translation: Like a thug visiting a wealthy person and said,

gurmukhi: kCu dyhu iBCw miRg nYn hmY ieh ryK imtwie hmY Ab hI ]
transliteration: Kachh(u) Deh(u) Bhichhaadmrig Nain Hamai Eh Rekh Mitaae Hamai Ab Hee||
translation: “O doe-eyed, cross this line and give me some alms,”

gurmukhi: ibnu ryK BeI Aivlok leI hir sIA aufXo niB kau qb hI ]355]
transliteration: Bin(u) Rekh Bhaiavilok Laihar(i) Seea Udyo Nabh(i) Kau Tab Hee||355||
translation: And when Ravan saw Sita crossing the line, he seized her and began to fly towards the sky.355.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk rwm vqwr kQw sIqw hrn iDAwie smwpqm ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachitra Natke Raam Avtaar Kathaa Sitaa Haran Dhiaae Samaaptam||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled ‘Abduction of Sita’ in Ramavtar in BACHITTAR NATAK.
Now begin the description about the search for Sita :
